body:
Sooo a few days back I was playing a game on Nebula Frostbite...
Then about 4 people (no names mentioned)started talking about DDoS
One threatened to DDoS another and it became a really heated arguement,eventually leading to sexual content....
Soooo I just wanted to ask the community about what I should do about this,I got a few screenshots....
I know this might sound dumb but I am at a loss,I cannot upload the screenshots to public in order not to reveal any names.

title: Is talking about DDoS in Avicus forbidden?

replies.body:
Yes, threatening to DDoS someone is not allowed. 
Skype is different however.

replies.body: DDos: DDos is When you or someone else (hacker) overloads your system causing it to malfunction, So make sure u have at LEAST 4 TB of memory left on your PC :/
replies.body_tagged: DDos: DDos is When you or someone else (hacker) overloads your system causing it to malfunction, So make sure u have at LEAST 4 TB of memory left on your PC :/

replies.body: Not even close.  A DDoS (Distributive Denial of Service) attack is when a user uses networks from different places to flood packets into one person's router or modem, thus overloading it, therefore denying the user's system access to the internet.  Having memory has nothing to do with it, you just have to use methods to protect your router and IP, such as VPN services and making a good choice in your ISP and router companies.
replies.body_tagged: Not even close.  A DDoS (Distributive Denial of Service) attack is when a user uses networks from different places to flood packets into one person's router or modem, thus overloading it, therefore denying the user's system access to the internet.  Having memory has nothing to do with it, you just have to use methods to protect your router and IP, such as VPN services and making a good choice in your ISP and router companies.
